commands.name: list
commands.help: List options for various CLI options

args.name: arg
args.help: Possible categories to list options for.

args.name: classifier
args.help: Classifier to view. Use `list` for options.

commands.name: generator-params
commands.help: View parameters for a feature generator

args.name: generator
args.help: Generator to view. Use `list` for options.

commands.name: run
commands.help: Train a classifier and store the results

args.name: input-mode
args.help: Generator to use. Use `list` for options.

args.name: output-mode
args.help: Output mode to use. Use `list` for options.

args.name: params
args.help: Generator params. Items in the name=value format.

args.name: ontology-classes
args.help: Path to a file containing ontology classes.

args.name: apply-ontology-classes
args.help: Enable application of ontology classes

args.name: classifier
args.help: Classifier to use. Use `list` for options

args.name: epochs
args.help: Amount of training epochs

args.name: split-size
args.help: Size of testing and validation splits.

args.name: max-train
args.help: Maximum amount of training items. -1 for infinite

args.name: k-cross
args.help: Enable k-fold cross-validation.

args.name: quick-cross
args.help: Enable k-fold cross validation

args.name: cross-project
args.help: Run cross project validation.

args.name: cache-features
args.help: Force caching of features. NOTE: the pipeline does not handle cache invalidation!

args.name: architectural-only
args.help: If specified, only architectural issues are used

args.name: hyper-params
args.help: Hyper-parameters params. Items in the name=value format.

args.name: class-balancer
args.help: Enable Class-Balancing

args.name: batch-size
args.help: Specify the batch size used during training

args.name: peregrine
args.help: Specify to enable running on peregrine

args.name: combination-strategy
args.help: Strategy used to combine models. Use `combination-strategies` for more information.

args.name: ensemble-strategy
args.help: Strategy used to combine models. Use `combination-strategies` for more information.

args.name: stacking-meta-classifier
args.help: Classifier to use as meta-classifier in stacking.

args.name: stacking-meta-classifier-hyper-parameters
args.help: Hyper-parameters for the meta-classifier

args.name: stacking-use-concat
args.help: Use simple concatenation to create the input for the meta classifier

args.name: stacking-no-matrix
args.help: Disallow the use of matrices for meta classifier input

args.name: boosting-rounds
args.help: Amount of rounds in the boosting process

args.name: use-early-stopping
args.help: If specified, use early stopping.

args.name: early-stopping-patience
args.help: Patience used when using early stopping

args.name: early-stopping-min-delta
args.help: Minimum delta used when using early stopping. One entry for every attribute used.

args.name: early-stopping-attribute
args.help: Attribute(s) to use for early stopping (from the validation set)

args.name: test-separately
args.help: If given, disable combining multiple classifiers. In stead, test them separately on the same data.

args.name: store-model
args.help: If given, store the trained model. Can only be used when training a single model.

args.name: model-id
args.help: ID of the model being trained. Must be present in the database. (only required for storage)

args.name: analyze-keywords
args.help: Compute a list of important keywords (convolutional mode only)

args.name: include-detection-performance
args.help: Include a separate evaluation of a classification model, as if it were used for detection

args.name: training-data-query
args.help: Query to obtain data from the database for training

args.name: test-data-query
args.help: Query to obtain data from the database for performance evaluation

args.name: database-url
args.help: URL of the database (wrapper)

args.name: test-with-training-data
args.help: Draw testing data from training data using train/test split

args.name: num-threads
args.help: Number of threads to use for preprocessing

commands.name: train
commands.help: Variant of the `run` command which loads a config from the database.

args.name: database-url
args.help: URL of the database (wrapper)

args.name: model-id
args.help: ID of the model being trained. Must be present in the database. (only required for storage)

args.name: num-threads
args.help: Number of threads to use for preprocessing

commands.name: predict
commands.help: Use an existing classifier to make predictions on new data.

args.name: database-url
args.help: URL of the database (wrapper)

args.name: with-tag
args.help: Optional tag to add to all predicted issues

args.name: num-threads
args.help: Number of threads to use for preprocessing

commands.name: generate-embedding
commands.description: Generate a word or document embedding for use in a feature generator

args.name: generator
args.help: Generator to use

args.name: target-file
args.help: Target file to save the embedding to

args.name: params
args.help: Parameters to pass to the embedding generator

args.name: database-url
args.help: URL of the database (wrapper)

args.name: training-data-query
args.help: query to retrieve data to train the embedding

args.name: formatting-handling
args.help: How to handling formatting

args.name: num-threads
args.help: Number of threads to use for preprocessing

commands.name: embedding-parameters
commands.help: Show available parameters for an embedding generator

args.name: generator
args.help: Generator to use

commands.name: combination-strategies
commands.help: Give a comprehensive overview of all available model combination strategies.

commands.name: serve
commands.help: Run the pipeline as a web api

args.name: port
args.help: Port to bind to

args.name: keyfile
args.help: SLL Keyfile

args.name: certfile
args.help: SSL cerfile

subparsers.name: run_analysis
subparsers.help: Analyze the results of deep learning runs

commands.name: summarize
commands.help: display the results for a single run

args.name: file
args.help: File whose content to summarize

args.name: short
args.help: If given, only give the four main metrics.

args.name: trim
args.help: If given, perform early-stopping analysis

args.name: patience
args.help: Patience for early stopping analysis

args.name: min-index
args.help: Min-index for early stopping analysis

args.name: min-delta
args.help: Min-delta for early stopping analysis

args.name: trimming-attribute
args.help: Attributes to perform early stopping with

args.name: max-attribute
args.help: Attribute for selecting the best run of a k-fold

commands.name: plot
commands.help: Plot various metrics in a plot

args.name: files
args.help: Files to analyze

args.name: attributes
args.help: Attributes to plot

args.name: plot-type
args.help: Type of plot to make. Either `line` or `bar`.

args.name: include-maxima
args.help: Whether to mark near-global maxima in the plots

args.name: tolerance
args.help: Tolerance when determining near-global maxima

commands.name: plot-attributes
commands.help: Plot an attribute across all folds.

commands.name: confusion
commands.help: Plot the confusion matrix of the given file

commands.name: compare-stats
commands.help: Test statistical significance of difference between k-fold runs.

args.name: attribute
args.help: Attribute to compare
